stimulusHtml: Respond to all parts of the question.

features.html:
In answering the question, you should emphasize the line of reasoning that generated your results; it is not enough to list the results of your analysis. Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes.

Labor productivity is output per unit of labor. An increase in labor productivity is a source of economic growth.

  1. Identify two sources of increase in labor productivity.

  2. Assume that a countryâ€™s economy is at full employment. Productivity has been rising. Using a correctly labeled graph of aggregate demand and aggregate supply, show the long-run effect of the growth in productivity on each of the following.

    1. Real output

    2. Price level

  3. Assume that the economy produces only two goods, good X and good Y. Using a correctly labeled production possibility diagram, show the effect of the increase in labor productivity
